Description: Shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: glazed at junction of shoulder and neck (now lost); below, frieze of alternating black and red tongues; below, black-figure hoplites (of first hoplite, part of helmet with red and raised arm holding spear, to left; of second, helmet with red and raised arm holding spear, to right).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as Louvre AM1360 (24) and AM1360 (1).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.183) (phase 3)
